βέλος.definition: a missile, i.e. spear or arrow

Βερνίκη.definition: victorious; Bernice, a member of the Herodian family

ἀδόκιμος.definition: unapproved, i.e. rejected; by implication, worthless (literally or morally)

Βεροιαῖος.definition: a Berœoean or native of Berœa

Βηθαβαρά.definition: ferry-house; Bethabara (i.e. Bethabarah), a place on the Jordan

Βηθανία.definition: date-house; Beth-any, a place in Palestine

Βηθεσδά.definition: house of kindness; Beth-esda, a pool in Jerusalem

Βηθλεέμ.definition: Bethleem (i.e. Beth-lechem), a place in Palestine

Βηθσαϊδά.definition: fishing-house; Bethsaida, a place in Palestine

Βηθφαγή.definition: fig-house; Beth-phage, a place in Palestine

βῆμα.definition: a step, i.e. foot-breath; by implication, a rostrum, i.e. a tribunal

βιάζω.definition: to force, i.e. (reflexively) to crowd oneself (into), or (passively) to be seized

βίος.definition: life, i.e. (literally) the present state of existence; by implication, the means of livelihood

βίωσις.definition: living (properly, the act, by implication, the mode)

βλάπτω.definition: properly, to hinder, i.e. (by implication) to injure

βλαστάνω.definition: to germinate; by implication, to yield fruit

Βλάστος.definition: Blastus, an officer of Herod Agrippa

βλασφημέω.definition: to vilify; specially, to speak impiously

βλάσφημος.definition: scurrilious, i.e. calumnious (against men), or (specially) impious (against God)

Βοανεργές.definition: sons of commotion; Boanerges, an epithet of two of the apostles

βοάω.definition: to halloo, i.e. shout (for help or in a tumultuous way)

βοή.definition: a halloo, i.e. call (for aid, etc.)

βοήθεια.definition: aid; specially, a rope or chain for frapping a vessel

βόθυνος.definition: a hole (in the ground); specially, a cistern
